timeline.title: The Foundation
timeline.description: Anokhi was founded with a mission rooted in craft conservation and development through design and project funding.

timeline.title: Design Studio Establishment
timeline.description: The spacious, verdant workplace on the outskirts of Jaipur became the heart of Anokhi's design studio and craft development.

timeline.title: International Recognition
timeline.description: Anokhi's distinctive prints, silhouettes and product quality gained recognition in small stores and online businesses across the globe.

timeline.title: Archive Development
timeline.description: The ANOKHI archive of swatches, paper patterns, toiles and samples grew to span over decades of creativity and craft industry collaboration.

timeline.title: Craft Conservation Focus
timeline.description: Anokhi became an alternative role model for good business practices and the ongoing revival of traditional skills.

timeline.title: 54 Years of Heritage
timeline.description: Continuing the legacy of craft conservation through design, maintaining quality and constancy through personalized in-store experiences.

craftsmanship.title: The Art of Hand-Block Printing
craftsmanship.description: Our textiles are created using traditional hand-block printing techniques passed down through generations of skilled artisans.

process.description: Each design begins as a hand-drawn pattern, carefully crafted by our design team in collaboration with master artisans.
Master craftsmen carve intricate designs into wooden blocks, each one unique and handcrafted with precision.
We use only natural, eco-friendly dyes derived from plants, minerals, and other organic sources.
Artisans hand-print each piece using traditional techniques, ensuring every item is unique and authentic.
Each finished piece undergoes rigorous quality checks to ensure it meets our high standards.
